definition: having a continuous even surface, being the representation of a function with a continuous first derivative, having or being a short even coat of hair, — compare rough, wirehaired

examples: the smooth course of his life

definition: even and uninterrupted in flow or flight
excessively and often artfully suave : ingratiating
to free from what is harsh or disagreeable : polish
to minimize (something, such as a fault) especially in order to allay anger or ill will
examples: his main job is to smooth over the friction that so often arises

definition: to free from obstruction or difficulty
examples: conciliation smoothed the way to an agreement
smoothed down the folds of her dress

definition: to remove expression from (one's face) : compose
to cause to lie evenly and in order : preen
to free (a graph, a collection of data, etc.) from irregularities
